title: EM waves - rank frequency for gamma radio visible

content.question: Which of the following correctly compares the frequencies <math alttext="f sub gamma" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>gamma</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="f sub radio" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>radio</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="f sub visible" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>visible</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> of gamma rays, radio waves, and visible light, respectively, when they travel in a vacuum?

choices.label: <math alttext="f sub gamma, end sub, equals, f sub radio, end sub, which equals, f sub visible, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>gamma</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>radio</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>visible</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="f sub gamma, end sub, is greater than, f sub visible, end sub, which is greater than, f sub radio, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>gamma</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>visible</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>radio</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="f sub radio, end sub, is greater than, f sub visible, end sub, which is greater than, f sub gamma, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>radio</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>visible</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>gamma</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="f sub visible, end sub, is greater than, f sub gamma, end sub, which is greater than, f sub radio, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>visible</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>gamma</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>radio</mtext></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="f sub gamma, end sub, is greater than, f sub visible, end sub, which is greater than, f sub radio, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>gamma</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>visible</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mtext>radio</mtext></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
